title: New York Joins States Delaying Booster Mandate for Healthcare Workers
sub_head: Similar steps were taken in California and Connecticut amid warnings that staff shortages might get worse
body:
New York has become the latest state to delay a mandate for healthcare workers to receive Covid-19 vaccine boosters after warnings that the rule would worsen existing staffing shortages at hospitals and nursing homes.
Health Commissioner Mary Bassett said Friday that officials wouldnâ€™t enforce the booster requirement that was set to take effect Monday. California and Connecticut recently pushed back their requirements for healthcare workers to be boosted to March 1 and March 7, respectively.
